answers.answer: Just relax..  dats all u need to do..  are u getting an epidural?
It's fast, make sure to get an epidural as well. Everything will be fine.

Painful!!I don't mean to scare you but being induced was 10x more painful than my first labor!Just relax, breathe, and try not to panic when the painful contractions hit. I did and it made them much worse!Good luck!!

I have been attending hpynobirthing classes and I am 35weeks now.  I have actually found out that being induced will aggravate your high blood pressure more and will give so much stress on your baby's heart rate! Do a lot of research before u decide this!

There's risks for everything. Do not let other ppl's experiences scare you. Your dr is very well capable of administering an induction and I'm sure he wouldn't tell you to do something that was bad for you and baby. All you have to remember is to breathe and what helped me when I was induced was focusing on something in front of me like the clock and I would breathe as relaxing as possible and i would tell myself "this won't last forever, I'll have my baby soon" over and over. And if you EVER feel.uncomfortable it's your right to tell the dr or nurses. If you're blessed to have a doc like mine he will try to make it as easy as possible. I've had 4 inductions and will be haing a 5th with this pregnancy. And remember to read up so you know what will happen and ASK QUESTIONS if need be. Ask the dr not anyone else. I hope my advice helps don't be scared and remember to rey to relax you can't be in labor forever. God bless you and the baby :)

question: Hello,I am being induced this friday and have to say im a bit nervous. I will be 39 weeks and am being induced because of possible preeclampsia and high blood pressure. I guess im wondering what to expect and how its going to go and if anyone can tell me more about it. Im going in at 7:30 am. Thank you
title: inducing
